My bad. I was on that branch and thought it should go in before the release. Shall I make a new PR against master (with a revised patch)? How do I make sure it goes in the next rc?
@dmorel, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @artwr and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.
Replaced with https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2096
I'll try to add another test to bring the code coverage up
OK, sounds good.  I'll have it up later today (hopefully)
@bolkedebruin rebased and added a test.
@mremes, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @criccomini, @mtagle and @LeBlanc to be potential reviewers.
@bolkedebruin, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @ajayyadava, @r39132 and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.
@aoen, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @bolkedebruin and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.
LGTM +1
Thanks for fixing this @bolkedebruin
@aeon +1. The fixes changes the check from any FAILED or UPSTREAM failed task to make sure that all tasks are done and at least one is failed.
LGTM
Will +1 and merge when unit tests are there.
LGTM +1
I didn't modify `airflow/jobs.py`, so the decrease must be because I need to rebase
@aoen, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @ajayyadava and @gwax to be potential reviewers.
Build is successful: https://travis-ci.org/bolkedebruin/airflow/builds/204756018 will merge
LGTM
@bolkedebruin added unit test
@saguziel, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @alexvanboxel and @bolkedebruin to be potential reviewers.
@saguziel, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @bolkedebruin and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.

Can you please improve your commit message and include a unit test?

To clarify:
* The issue you are solving is not the Double Trigger, which is a separate issue. Here you are solving another issue, I guess something along the lines of "Fix determination of task to terminate". With a why and a what explained.

Will +1, after unit test is added and commit message describes properly why and what has changed. 

BTW: After reviewing I do think you are resolving a race condition between the TaskInstance and the LocalTaskJob, as the records where not properly locked (and refreshed) by the LocalTaskJob.

BTW, you mentioned on the mailinglist that issue was also true for the skipped
status (if a leaf task is skipped then the root task for the DAG will get
skipped and none of the other tasks in the DAG will run). The added test doesn't cover that, as far as I can see.

Hi @bolkedebruin 

I've added a couple of things:
- Proper killing of yarn jobs by overriding the on_kill. The output of the jobs will be parsed and the application_id is extracted from it. This only works when logging is set at `INFO` or lower, otherwise the concise and the application_id will not be emitted.
- Adding the deploy-mode argument (also to the connection string) as this has become the default since Spark 2.0.

I've added additional tests and refactored the code a bit. Let me know if it this is sufficient.

For a next pr I would like to add an abstract class for both the spark-{submit, sql} class, and also refactor the spark-sql operator to work with the Airflow connections.
@jakromm, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @zodiac, @mistercrunch and @jlowin to be potential reviewers.
Did you validate that this actually works?
NM, I see `bql` is just a string. Should be fine.
can this be done without adding new parameters to the constructor of DAG? it seems like this parameter will be the same for all DAGs
I figured people may want to specify it at a DAG level much like how you can for the orientation of the DAGs graph.  If you think it's overkill let me know.
Nice. Lgtm.
The problem here is the bug with refresh_from_db and the race condition between LocalTaskJob and TaskInstance, and that a second job that starts should not kill the original.
A bug with refresh from db?
It was not updating pid
Yeah you're right I think that's a different issue though. I will try to find a repro case with our users and see if I can repro it.
This is ready to be merged.

That was due to the race I think. That is not a bug with the refresh as that was not even there. The proper way in area should have been a ti.refresh_from_db(lock_for_update=True, session=session). That would have allowed a proper storIng of the pid.
Lgtm does your personal repo pass Travis tests? We are throttled
Yeah: https://travis-ci.org/aoen/incubator-airflow/builds/205089459
Look at line 1000. The part of refresh_from_db to update pid wasn't there.
That's what I meant ;-)
@djarratt, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @patrickleotardif and @aoen to be potential reviewers.
Realizing that this flash icon exists in many files. If the icon change is appropriate, we can find and replace all of them relatively simply.
Maybe glyphicon-console is a good choice too?

@saguziel that's a good find. Pro: it clearly means "computer instructions". Con: airflow has a command line interface and the Code tab does not show information about the airflow CLI. I still prefer glyphicon-file because the Code tab is literally the file that was submitted to airflow, despite the file icon having ambiguity around what sort of file it is. I also thought about glyphicon-folder-open, but folders denote a container whereas Code is always just a single file.
I'm fine with the file icon. Let's change it in all of the places it's referenced and then will LGTM.
@djarratt, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @zodiac and @normster to be potential reviewers.
LGTM
This does test that PID is set correctly, but the test doesn't quite test the actual behavior as expected because of test_mode and would be impossible without turning it off

This at least tests some functionality (the task will abort itself if it sees another running with a different hostname/pid pair), but doesn't do the real version which is not even run when another task is running.

Hey @saguziel, I was typing on a phone so I might have been too brief. When two tasks are executed at the same time the 1) original task needs keep running and 2) the other task needs to terminate. Your tests cover 1 perfectly, but you are not covering 2. This can be done quite easily with `assertFalse(p2.isAlive())`, if needed with a small timeout if required to give the task instance time to terminate itself.

Or should I read this differently?
Gotcha.
LGTM, if builds pass (link to own repo accepted as we are severely throttled).
ok, good. I observed this bug in this nights production run. Here is a second +1
Unfortunately looks like @saguziel's travis run got hit by the branch operator issue: https://travis-ci.org/saguziel/incubator-airflow/builds/205231164
Yep we need to get to the bottom of this.
